member.name: T:Terrarium.Configuration.CachedBooleanConfig
member.summary: Facilitates the creation of boolean configuration variables using the XmlConfig class. Since all values are retrieved as strings, the values are first retrieved, then cached, and finally parsed into boolean variables. When values can't be parsed the class allows a default value to be set.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.CachedBooleanConfig._booleanName
member.summary: Field representing the name of the setting in the config file

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.CachedBooleanConfig._booleanString
member.summary: Field representing the string or config representation of the setting

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.CachedBooleanConfig._booleanValue
member.summary: Field representing the boolean value of the setting

member.name: M:Terrarium.Configuration.CachedBooleanConfig.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize a new CachedBooleanConfig given the name of the configuration setting and the initial default boolean value of false.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Configuration.CachedBooleanConfig.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize a new CachedBooleanConfig given teh name fo the configuration setting and an initial default value.
member.param: Name of the config file setting.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Configuration.CachedBooleanConfig.Getter
member.summary: Used to retrieve the value of this boolean config setting. If the value has not been processed before then it is retrieved and processed, else it is returned from cache.
member.returns: True/False value of the current setting.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Configuration.CachedBooleanConfig.Setter(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Used to set the value of a setting. This method will create the setting if it doesn't exist, or update it otherwise.
member.param: New True/False value for the setting.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Configuration.CountrySettings
member.summary: This class is used to enumerate and validate countries/regions. Note: the list in this class may not be 100% complete or accurate.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.CountrySettings.Countries
member.summary: Provides direct access to the country/region array listing

member.name: M:Terrarium.Configuration.CountrySettings.Validate(System.String)
member.summary: Validates a string value against the array of countries/regions. Note this looks for a direct match and doesn't match variations or abbreviations,
member.param: A string value to match against the list of countries/regions
member.returns: True if the string matches one of the countries/regions in the list, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig
member.summary: Centralized class file giving strongly typed access to all user configuration file values. This class primarily encapsulates a series of string and boolean values, but can be extended for more complex values, like the State and Country classes.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._backgroundGrid
member.summary: Field representing the background grid rendering state

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._boundingBoxes
member.summary: Field representing the bounding box rendering state

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._demoMode
member.summary: Field representing the Demo Mode state.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._destinationLines
member.summary: Field representing the destination lines rendering state

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._discoveryOverride
member.summary: Field representing the use of the discovery override for the network engine

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._drawScreen
member.summary: Field representing the screen drawing rendering state

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._enableNat
member.summary: Field representing the use of a NAT device for the network engine

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._largeGraphicsMode
member.summary: Field representing the large graphics modes rendering state

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._screenSaverSpanMonitors
member.summary: Field that represents whether to start in fullscreen (maximized) mode.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._skipVersionCheck
member.summary: Allows a client to skip checking the server for disabled versions

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._startFullscreen
member.summary: Field that represents whether to start in fullscreen (maximized) mode.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._useSimpleScreenSaver
member.summary: Field representing whether to use the simple screen saver

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._applicationDirectory
member.summary: Field representing the location of application files.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._blockedVersionString
member.summary: Field representing the version string of a blocked terrarium

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._localIPAddress
member.summary: Field representing the local IP address to use for the network engine

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._loggingMode
member.summary: Field representing the current trace logging mode for the Hosting code

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._mediaDirectory
member.summary: Field representing the location of media files for the graphics engine

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._peerList
member.summary: Field representing a comma separated list of peers for use with discovery override.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._styleName
member.summary: Field representing the Metal Style that Terrarium should use for the custom controls.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._userCountry
member.summary: Field representing the user's country/region as set by the peer properties dialogue. This value is sent during teleportation.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._userEmail
member.summary: Field representing the user's email address. This value is used when sending error reports to the Terrarium server and is useful in contacting the user for additional details or a repro case.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._userState
member.summary: Field representing the user's state as set by the peer properties dialogue. This value is sent during teleportation.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig._webRoot
member.summary: Field representing the Terrarium server to connect to for peer discovery and reporting. This value is also used to create the bin directory for storing game state.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.GetSetting(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a setting from the user configuration file based on a setting name. This method only retrieves the text of the element in string format.
member.param: Name of the setting to retrieve.
member.returns: Returns the value of the setting on success or an empty string if it doesn't.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.SetSetting(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a user configuration file value given the setting name and the new value in string format. This method will write new values, or update existing values.
member.param: Name of the setting to create or update.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.WriteConfigFileFromResources(System.String)
member.summary: This is a *safe* method for writing out a static configuration file from the embedded configuration resource file. We have to have a template to build from. We could use the GameConfig to build one, but this allows us to pick and choose which options will be in the stock config without complicated code.
member.param: This should be a pointer to UserSettingsLocation

member.name: M:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.GetUserSettings
member.summary: Gets the current user configuration settings in the form of an XmlDocument file.
member.returns: An XmlDocument initalized with settings on success, null otherwise.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.CheckConfigFile
member.summary: Checks the user configuration file for accessibility by attempting to retrive the user settings. If the file doesn't exist then a general exception is found and caught by GetUserSettings. Other exceptions will get passed back to the callee. This is primarily used to detect permissions errors with respect to the config file.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.ShowErrors
member.summary: Determines if the Terrarium Client should give a visible cue when errors occur. By default errors are always shown except when in Demo Mode. Demo Mode is useful for presentations where an error dialogue might interrupt the user experience.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.AllowUpdates
member.summary: Determines whether the Terrarium Client should accept updates from the update server. By default updates are allowed unless the client is in Demo Mode.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.UseLargeGraphics
member.summary: Determines whether the Terrarium Client graphics engine should use large graphics for the rendering engine. Large graphics are full size 48x48 sprites in most skins, or the largest available sprite size if 48x48 sprites don't exist.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.DemoMode
member.summary: Determines whether or not the Terrarium Client is in demonstration mode. Certain features are disabled when the client is in demonstration mode while other features are enabled.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.LoggingMode
member.summary: Retrieves the current logging mode. Logging modes are used to determine how creature trace output is handled. The default trace logging allows for trace output to be placed on the debugger output stream.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.DrawScreen
member.summary: Retrieves the current graphics drawing mode. Graphics can be turned on and off to limit processor usage by the graphics engine.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.DestinationLines
member.summary: Determines if creature destination lines should be drawn through the graphics engine. Destination lines use more CPU but are useful for movement debugging.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.BackgroundGrid
member.summary: Determines if a special background is painted using the rendering engine that contains a grid overlay identical to the Terrarium Engine's cell grid.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.BoundingBoxes
member.summary: Determines if cell boundary bounding boxes are drawn for creatures. Bounding boxes use more CPU but are useful for movement debugging.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.EnableNat
member.summary: Determines if features of the Network Engine are bypassed in order to enable NAT devices. This turns off several checks that would normally stop the Terrarium Client from running.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.UseConfigForDiscovery
member.summary: Specifies whether the config file or the Terrarium Server web service should be used for peer discovery. This option is used in conjunction with PeerList.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.BlockedVersion
member.summary: Specifies a blocked version number. A Terrarium Deployment Server can be used to shut-down potentially dangerous clients. The user will have to remove this option from the config file or upgrade their client to continue playing.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.LocalIPAddress
member.summary: Specifies the Local IP Address of this host rather than retrieving the value from the network adapter list.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.PeerList
member.summary: Specifies a comma separated value listing of peer IP addresses to connect to in the absence of a peer discovery service. This is enabled whenever the discovery override option is enabled.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.WebRoot
member.summary: Used by the Terrarium Client to build the Web Service url's for connecting with a Terrarium server for discovery and reporting.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.StyleName
member.summary: Contains the name of the Metal Style file to load and set as the active style

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.MediaDirectory
member.summary: Creates the location used to retrieve the media files for the graphics engine. The value is generated using the location of the currently executing assembly.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.ApplicationDirectory
member.summary: Returns the full path to the application.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.CpuThrottle
member.summary: Retrieves a special CPU Throttle value that controls how many creatures can run inside of a Terrarium Values less than 100 will operate the Terrarium with less creatures than normal, while values greater than 100 will cause more creatures than normal to operate.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.UserCountry
member.summary: Retrieves the current country/region of the user. This value is set by the user by using the Peer Properties dialogue.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.UserState
member.summary: Retrieves the current state of the user if the user is located within the United States. This value is set by the Peer Properties dialogue.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.UserEmail
member.summary: Retrieves the current user's email address as set in the Peer Properties dialogue. This value is sent in debug reports to the server so that the user can be contacted.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.RelaunchCommandLine
member.summary: A special value used to relaunch the terrarium with a given command line. This is used by the auto-update service and when the user switches between Terrarium Mode/EcoSystem Mode.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.UseSimpleScreenSaver
member.summary: Allows the user to specify that when running in screen saver mode, to just use the "simple" screen saver rather than actually running the Terrarium client. No UI to access this, user would hand edit the userconfig.xml

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.StartFullscreen
member.summary: Allows the user to specify whether Terrarium should start in fullscreen mode.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.ScreenSaverSpanMonitors
member.summary: Allows the screen saver to span multiple monitors. Should be considered experimental as we make no guarantees it will work depending on video memory, etc.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.SkipVersionCheck
member.summary: Allows the client to skip checking the server for disabled versions.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.GameConfigDirectory
member.summary: This property is used to retrieve the location of the game settings file to make it more visible to the user. NOTE: this is used to store user config and skin settings.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.UserSettingsLocation
member.summary: This property is used to retrieve the location of the user settings file. The value is based on the location of the currently executing assembly, generally the Terrarium client.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Configuration.GameConfig.UserSettingsExists
member.summary: This property is used to find if the User Settings file exists. If it doesn't, then write it out of our cached resource.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Configuration.StateSettings
member.summary: This class is used to enumerate and validate the list of 50 US States.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Configuration.StateSettings.States
member.summary: Provides direct access to the state array listing

member.name: M:Terrarium.Configuration.StateSettings.Validate(System.String)
member.summary: Validates a string value against the array of states. Note this looks for a direct match and doesn't match variations or two character state abbreviations
member.param: A string value to match against the list of states
member.returns: True if the string matches one of the 50 states, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Tools.ErrorLog
member.summary: Centralized logging class for loggin handle/unhandled exceptions. This class caches various calls in order to generate a dataset when a fatal error occurs. This dataset is then formatted and sent to the Terrarium Watson Service.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.ErrorLog._syncObject
member.summary: A Mutex object used to make the ErrorLog class threadsafe and to synchronize access to certain methods and resources.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.ErrorLog._machineName
member.summary: The name of the machine the client is running on

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.ErrorLog.LogHandledException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Log handled exceptions. This can be used in order to review handled exceptions to make sure things are happening correctly.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.ErrorLog.FormatException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Formats and exception object. Currently, only the SocketException makes use fo the custom formatting logic. Other formats can easily be added.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.ErrorLog.LogFailedAssertion(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Logs a failed assertion. Any failed assertions launch the Watson dialog which is then used to submit an error report to the Terrarium Watson Service.
member.param: A series of cached previous tracings

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.ErrorLog.LogFailedAssertion(System.String)
member.summary: Logs a failed assertion. Any failed assertions launch the Watson dialog which is then used to submit an error report to the Terrarium Watson Service.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.ErrorLog.CreateErrorLogDataSet(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an error dataset to be reported to the Terrarium Watson Service. Each dataset has information about the machine, the OS, the version of the game, the type of log, and optionally some an email and user comment.
member.param: The type of log Assertion or Unhandled Exception generally.
The error log text, generally a compilation of the exception and previous tracings.
member.returns: A Watson Service DataSet that can be used in a web service call.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Tools.ErrorLog.MachineName
member.summary: Used to set and retrieve the name of the machine the client is running on.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Tools.Profiler
member.summary: Encompasses the logic to profile the DirectDraw classes

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.Profiler._profileKeys
member.summary: Contains named profiles

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.Profiler.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new DirectDrawProfiler and clears any profiler settings by creating a new Hashtable.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.Profiler.ClearProfiler
member.summary: Clears any profiler data.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.Profiler.Start(System.String)
member.summary: Starts profiling the function or profile of the given name.
member.param: Name of the function or profile to time.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.Profiler.End(System.String)
member.summary: Ends the profiling of a given function or profile node.
member.param: Name of the function or profile node to stop timing.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Tools.Profiler.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Default indexed property that gives access to nodes by their key name.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Tools.Profiler.Nodes
member.summary: Returns all nodes currently in the profiler. This can be used for generated node reports.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Tools.ProfilerNode
member.summary: Represents an invidual function or profiler node

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.ProfilerNode._timeMonitor
member.summary: Access to the high performance timers.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.ProfilerNode._isCounting
member.summary: True if start has been called

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.ProfilerNode._lastTime
member.summary: The amount of time consumed by the last call

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.ProfilerNode._runningTotal
member.summary: The total amount of time consumed by all calls.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.ProfilerNode._samples
member.summary: The number of times the node has been called.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.ProfilerNode.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new node given an id. Sets up the initial TimeMonitor used to record high performance timings.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.ProfilerNode.Start
member.summary: Start a timing session.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.ProfilerNode.End
member.summary: End a timing session and update the running total, samples, and last timing variables.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener
member.summary: The TerrariumTraceListener is responsible for stopping the painting timer whenever an error or assertion occurs.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener.TraceBufferMaxLength
member.summary: Maximum number of characters to store in the trace buffer. A trace buffer can be built of multiple tracings and this value is responsible for controlling truncation of the buffer.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener._defaultListener
member.summary: Holds an instance of the default trace listener

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener._enableLogging
member.summary: Enables logging traces to a debug text file

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener._traceBuilder
member.summary: Builds a tracing string using a performance optimized string builder

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener._timerToStop
member.summary: Holds an instance of the drawing timer so that it can be stopped when an error or assertion occurs.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a default TerrariumTraceListener with logging turned off

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a TerrariumTraceListener with a custom value for logging.
member.param: If True logging is turned on, off otherwise

member.summary: Used for logging failure messages

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener.Fail(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Used for logging failure messages, along with a detailed message

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Used for logging standard messages

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener.Write(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Used for logging categorized messages
member.param: Object to log, ToString will be called.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener.Write(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Used for logging categorized messages

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener.Write(System.Object)
member.summary: Used for logging standard messages
member.param: Object to log, ToString will be called.

member.summary: Used for categorized message logging
member.param: Object to log, ToString will be called.

member.summary: Used for logging categorized messages

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener.WriteLine(System.Object)
member.summary: Used for logging standard messages

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener.WriteLine(System.String)
member.summary: Used for logging standard messages

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener.showErrorDialog(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates and displays an error dialog if game errors are enabled. If the dialog fails to show then the Application is exited. If the user clicks the Cancel button the Applicaton is exited.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Tools.TerrariumTraceListener.TimerToStop
member.summary: Retreives or sets the current drawing timer.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Tools.TimeMonitor
member.summary: This class provides in-direct access to the high frequency performance counters for very accurate timings.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.TimeMonitor.MicroSecondsPerSecond
member.summary: The number of microseconds in a single second

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.TimeMonitor._apiOverHead
member.summary: A value representing the overhead of calling the time monitor class

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.TimeMonitor._ticksPerSec
member.summary: Number of ticks per second retrieved using QueryPerformanceFrequency

member.name: F:Terrarium.Tools.TimeMonitor._startCounter
member.summary: The starting value of the timer class, as set by a call to Start

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TimeMonitor.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new time monitor for computing small differences in time. Only short timings should be made since thread switching can cause abnormal values in the windows environment.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TimeMonitor.GetCounterSeconds
member.summary: Used to retrieve the number of seconds elapsed in this counter. This should only be called after a call to Start.
member.returns: The amount of time elapsed in seconds.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TimeMonitor.Start
member.summary: Starts the timing class by making a call to QueryPerformanceCounter for the current time.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TimeMonitor.EndGetMicroseconds
member.summary: Used to retreive the number of microseconds elapsed in this counter. This should only be called after a call to Start. This method subtracts out the overhead time of calling the Start and End methods.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TimeMonitor.FreqToMicroSecs(System.Double)
member.summary: Method used to turn an elapsed time in frequency counts into an elapsed natural time. This method also removes the overhead of calling the performance counter methods.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TimeMonitor.QueryPerformanceFrequency(System.Double@)
member.summary: Used to query the system timer frequency. Returns counts per second. Ref parameter is a LARGE_INTEGER

member.name: M:Terrarium.Tools.TimeMonitor.QueryPerformanceCounter(System.Double@)
member.summary: Used to query the number of elapsed intervals in the system timer.

member.name: P:Terrarium.Tools.TimeMonitor.IsStarted
member.summary: Determines if the current time monitor has been started already.

member.name: T:Terrarium.Forms.ReportBug
member.summary: A dialog used to report a user submitted bug. This is similar to the Watson dialog, but doesn't contain exception information.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Forms.ReportBug.errorInformation
member.summary: The dataset holding the error information to send to the Watson Service.

member.name: F:Terrarium.Forms.ReportBug.textChanged
member.summary: If the text changes then a click on the Send button will submit the text. Otherwise it won't

member.name: F:Terrarium.Forms.ReportBug.components
member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Forms.ReportBug.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor used to create a new User bug reporting form.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Forms.ReportBug.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Forms.ReportBug.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Forms.ReportBug.Send_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Send event handler. This method sends the user bug dataset to the Watson Web Service.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Forms.ReportBug.Form_Load(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Create a default dataset on form load initialized to type "UserBug" with no previous tracings.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Forms.ReportBug.DontSend_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: DontSend event handler used to close the form down without sending anything to the server.

member.name: M:Terrarium.Forms.ReportBug.Information_TextChanged(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Information event handler used to determine if the text is changed.
